name: syntactically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
language in a way that relates to the grammatical arrangement of words in a sentence: a syntactically complicated language
computing in a way that relates to the structure of statements or elements in a computer language: I hoped the query was syntactically correct. See
syntax
More examplesFewer examplesBSL is the preferred language of more than 50,000 people and is syntactically very different from English. For example, syntactically, verbs with causative meanings (e. g. bring, feed, break) are all transitive.They're the same word, but they're not doing the same thing, syntactically, at all. The terms may have the same superordinate and be used syntactically in the same way.If the user inputs syntactically invalid data, an asterisk ( *) appears beside the field in error and an error message is displayed.
